name: Genuinely Silly Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Mr. Howell is captured and imprisoned. The Professor and the Skipper try to rescue him, leading one to utter a statement that has become legendary: 'let's get the Howell out of here'.
questions.explanation:
Gilligan's Island.

	More puns to follow.

questions.text: Darryl Strawberry, outfielder for the Yankees 1995-1999, was being considered as a defensive replacement: he wouldn't hit, but he'd only play the outfield. That would mean that 'Strawberry Fields Forever'.
Jennifer O'Neill did an ad for Off-Track Betting (in New York): 'Jenny and the Bets'.
questions.explanation:
Elton John.

	'Bennie and the Jets'. Close enough.

questions.text: Oliver Twist asked for more food, but had one request of the chef: 'don't be gruel'.
questions.explanation:
Elvis Presley.

	'Cruel'. Not a bad song.

questions.text: Someone suggested to Shakespeare: 'there is nothing like a Dane'.
'There is nothing like a dane' suggests which musical?
After being advised that 'the way to a man's heart is through his stomach', a young woman tries to bake her way into his affection. Sadly, she remarks: 'you can't get a man with a bun'.
After being accused of treasonous activities, a prominent citizen exclaimed: 'Sedition? Sedition!'

A prizefighter was making the rounds of the smaller cities, working his way up the ladder. He progressed to Minneapolis, St. Paul and so on ... but his manager firmly insisted: 'you can't handle Duluth'.
questions.explanation:
A Few Good Men.

	Nicholson: 'the truth'.

questions.text: During his trip to some Spanish cities, John Wayne avoided going into mountainous areas. This led to the observation: 'the Wayne in Spain stays mainly on the plain'.
